SENT.plain: The influences of age, sex, disc level, and degree of degenration on the mechanical behavior of 42 fresh cadaver lumbar motion segments are reported

The motions and intradiscal pressure changes that result from the application of flexion, extension, lateral bending, and torsional moments; compression; and anterior, posterior, and lateral shears are described
The authors find that the mean behaviors of the different segment classes sometimes differ, but these differences are seldom pronounced
Scatter in the behavior of individual motion segments is pronounced, and very often overshadows any class differences
